notes.note: Use Framer Motion for animations (spring physics). Use Tailwind CSS for consistent spacing/colors. Use Radix UI for accessible components. Lazy load routes with React.lazy() and Suspense. Code split by route (React Router 6). Use React Query for caching (reduces API calls).

Test with real users who use assistive technology if possible. Use tools: Lighthouse (automated), axe DevTools (automated), WAVE (automated), NVDA (manual), JAWS (manual), VoiceOver (manual). Fix all critical/serious issues. Document known minor issues.

Optimize images (WebP format, lazy loading). Minimize bundle size (tree shaking, compression). Use CDN for static assets. Enable browser caching. Monitor with Lighthouse and Web Vitals. Target: LCP <2.5s, FID <100ms, CLS <0.1.

Micro-interactions matter. Button hover states, focus states, active states. Smooth transitions. Skeleton loaders (not spinners). Optimistic updates where possible. Toast notifications for success/error. Consistent terminology throughout.

Manual testing required for this story. Create testing checklist: (1) Accessibility audit, (2) Mobile responsiveness, (3) Browser compatibility, (4) Performance testing, (5) Screen reader testing. Document results in test report.
